I would like you to imagine
That every “service” and app you’ve been using on the internet
Every platform for “information” and “community”
Every “futuristic” device that made you feel “connected”
Was just there to collect
Your data
All along

Collate it, analyze it,
Segment and sell it
Carve you into a market segment
Deepening divides
Corner your biometrics
To train facial recognition
Colonize your habits and home
To develop an “AI” product

To sell to investors
And increase shareholder value

Currently considering:
- Only sharing links via archive.org, a non-profit whose site visits don’t rack up Chartbeat metrics
- Subscribing to actually independent and thought-provoking sites or reporters, typically longer form, many through Mastodon
-Keeping an eye on nonprofits that aggregate info, like the ACLU’s https://www.aclu.org/legislative-attacks-on-lgbtq-rights or the ADL maps https://www.adl.org/resources/tools-to-track-hate/heat-map
- Open source BBC or NPR news podcast via Mycroft.ai

How can we keep abreast of the rise of facism without enriching the platforms and services that hasten and profit off its coming? I already resist news links to 45 so as not to feed the frenzy and the engagement numbers. With social media and traditional media on mutual life support I want to support good journalism and stay informed, but not through click-baiting.

What sites do you use for awareness that don’t precipitate the decline?

I don’t know why Americans need to make up superheroes when they have Harriet Tubman. Who escaped from slavery, rescued hundreds of people, crisscrossed the east coast by foot undercover several times, led a victorious regiment in the Civil War... move over, Superman. And I still can’t believe she is not already on the money here. Maybe they’re afraid of what will happen when just by looking at a twenty, millions of people get inspired to be as unstoppable as Harriet Tubman every single day.
